trans-unit.source: Delivering Media on-Demand with Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: Delivering Media on-Demand with Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: This topic talks about common scenarios of delivering media on-demand with Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic talks about common scenarios of delivering media on-demand with Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Delivering Media on-Demand with Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: Delivering Media on-Demand with Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic describes steps of a typical Azure Media Services (AMS) Video-on-Demand workflow.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes steps of a typical Azure Media Services (AMS) Video-on-Demand workflow.

trans-unit.source: Each step links to relevant topics.
trans-unit.target: Each step links to relevant topics.

trans-unit.source: For tasks that can be achieved using different technologies, there are buttons that link to technology of your choice (for example, .NET or REST).
trans-unit.target: For tasks that can be achieved using different technologies, there are buttons that link to technology of your choice (for example, .NET or REST).

trans-unit.source: Note that you can integrate Media Services with your existing tools and processes.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can integrate Media Services with your existing tools and processes.

trans-unit.source: For example, encode content on-site, then upload to Media Services for transcoding into multiple formats and deliver through Azure CDN or a third-party CDN.
trans-unit.target: For example, encode content on-site, then upload to Media Services for transcoding into multiple formats and deliver through Azure CDN or a third-party CDN.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram shows the major parts of the Media Services platform that are involved in the Video on Demand Workflow.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram shows the major parts of the Media Services platform that are involved in the Video on Demand Workflow.

trans-unit.source: VoD workflow
trans-unit.target: VoD workflow

trans-unit.source: Common Scenarios: Delivering Media on-Demand
trans-unit.target: Common Scenarios: Delivering Media on-Demand

trans-unit.source: Protect content in storage and deliver streaming media in the clear (non-encrypted)
trans-unit.target: Protect content in storage and deliver streaming media in the clear (non-encrypted)

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to your asset in order to protect your content during upload and while at rest in storage.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to your asset in order to protect your content during upload and while at rest in storage.

trans-unit.source: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.
trans-unit.target: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to the output asset in order to protect your content at rest.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to apply storage encryption option to the output asset in order to protect your content at rest.

trans-unit.source: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging).
trans-unit.target: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging).

trans-unit.source: If your asset is storage encrypted, you **must** configure asset delivery policy.
trans-unit.target: If your asset is storage encrypted, you **must** configure asset delivery policy.

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream content.

trans-unit.source: Stream published content.
trans-unit.target: Stream published content.

trans-unit.source: Protect content in storage, deliver dynamically encrypted streaming media
trans-unit.target: Protect content in storage, deliver dynamically encrypted streaming media

trans-unit.source: To be able to use dynamic encryption, you must first get at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream encrypted content.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use dynamic encryption, you must first get at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you want to stream encrypted content.

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.

trans-unit.source: Apply storage encryption option to the asset.
trans-unit.target: Apply storage encryption option to the asset.

trans-unit.source: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.
trans-unit.target: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set.

trans-unit.source: Apply storage encryption option to the output asset.
trans-unit.target: Apply storage encryption option to the output asset.

trans-unit.source: Create encryption content key for the asset you want to be dynamically encrypted during playback.
trans-unit.target: Create encryption content key for the asset you want to be dynamically encrypted during playback.

trans-unit.source: Configure content key authorization policy.
trans-unit.target: Configure content key authorization policy.

trans-unit.source: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption).
trans-unit.target: Configure asset delivery policy (used by dynamic packaging and dynamic encryption).

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand locator.

trans-unit.source: Stream published content.
trans-unit.target: Stream published content.

trans-unit.source: Index content
trans-unit.target: Index content

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an Asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an Asset.

trans-unit.source: Index content.
trans-unit.target: Index content.

trans-unit.source: The indexing job generates files that can be used as Closed Captions (CC) in video playback.
trans-unit.target: The indexing job generates files that can be used as Closed Captions (CC) in video playback.

trans-unit.source: It also generates files that enable you to do in-video search and jump to the exact location of the video.
trans-unit.target: It also generates files that enable you to do in-video search and jump to the exact location of the video.

trans-unit.source: Consume indexed content.
trans-unit.target: Consume indexed content.

trans-unit.source: Deliver progressive download
trans-unit.target: Deliver progressive download

trans-unit.source: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.
trans-unit.target: Upload a high-quality mezzanine file into an asset.

trans-unit.source: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set or a single MP4.
trans-unit.target: Encode to adaptive bitrate MP4 set or a single MP4.

trans-unit.source: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand or SAS locator.
trans-unit.target: Publish the asset by creating an OnDemand or SAS locator.

trans-unit.source: If using OnDemand locator, make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you plan to progressively download content.
trans-unit.target: If using OnDemand locator, make sure to have at least one streaming reserved unit on the streaming endpoint from which you plan to progressively download content.

trans-unit.source: If using SAS locator, the content is downloaded from the Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: If using SAS locator, the content is downloaded from the Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you do not need to have streaming reserved units.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you do not need to have streaming reserved units.

trans-unit.source: Progressively download content.
trans-unit.target: Progressively download content.

trans-unit.source: This article contains links to topics that show how to set up your development environment and perform tasks mentioned above.
trans-unit.target: This article contains links to topics that show how to set up your development environment and perform tasks mentioned above.

trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.target: For concepts related to delivering your content on demand, see [Media Services Concepts](media-services-concepts.md).

trans-unit.target: Common Tasks: Delivering Media on-Demand

trans-unit.source: Creating a Media Services account
trans-unit.target: Creating a Media Services account

trans-unit.source: Use **Azure Management Portal** to [Create Azure Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: Use **Azure Management Portal** to [Create Azure Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Setting up development environment
trans-unit.target: Setting up development environment

trans-unit.source: Choose **.NET** or **REST API** for your development environment.
trans-unit.target: Choose **.NET** or **REST API** for your development environment.

trans-unit.source: Connecting programmatically
trans-unit.target: Connecting programmatically

trans-unit.source: Choose **.NET** or **REST API** to programmatically connect to Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Choose **.NET** or **REST API** to programmatically connect to Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Configuring streaming endpoints
trans-unit.target: Configuring streaming endpoints

trans-unit.source: For an overview about streaming endpoints and information on how to manage them, see [How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account](media-services-manage-origins.md).
trans-unit.target: For an overview about streaming endpoints and information on how to manage them, see [How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account](media-services-manage-origins.md).

trans-unit.source: Uploading media
trans-unit.target: Uploading media

trans-unit.source: Upload your files using **Azure Management Portal**, **.NET** or **REST API**.
trans-unit.target: Upload your files using **Azure Management Portal**, **.NET** or **REST API**.

trans-unit.source: Creating jobs / tasks
trans-unit.target: Creating jobs / tasks

trans-unit.source: A job is an entity that contains metadata about a set of tasks (for example, encoding or indexing).
trans-unit.target: A job is an entity that contains metadata about a set of tasks (for example, encoding or indexing).

trans-unit.source: Each task performs an atomic operation on the input asset(s).
trans-unit.target: Each task performs an atomic operation on the input asset(s).

trans-unit.source: For example on how to create encoding jobs, see:
trans-unit.target: For example on how to create encoding jobs, see:

trans-unit.source: For an overview, see [Working with Azure Media Services Jobs](media-services-jobs.md).
trans-unit.target: For an overview, see [Working with Azure Media Services Jobs](media-services-jobs.md).

trans-unit.source: Get a Media Processor appropriate for your task with **.NET** or **REST API**.
trans-unit.target: Get a Media Processor appropriate for your task with **.NET** or **REST API**.

trans-unit.source: The following examples create encoding jobs with **Azure Management Portal**, **.NET**, or **REST API**.
trans-unit.target: The following examples create encoding jobs with **Azure Management Portal**, **.NET**, or **REST API**.

trans-unit.source: Protecting content
trans-unit.target: Protecting content

trans-unit.source: **Overview**:
trans-unit.target: **Overview**:

trans-unit.source: Content Protection Overview
trans-unit.target: Content Protection Overview

trans-unit.source: If you want to encrypt an asset with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys) or PlayReady DRM, you need to create a content key.
trans-unit.target: If you want to encrypt an asset with Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) (using 128-bit encryption keys) or PlayReady DRM, you need to create a content key.

trans-unit.source: Use **.NET** or **REST API** to create keys.
trans-unit.target: Use **.NET** or **REST API** to create keys.

trans-unit.source: Once you create the content key, you can configure key authorization policy using **.NET** or **REST API**.
trans-unit.target: Once you create the content key, you can configure key authorization policy using **.NET** or **REST API**.

trans-unit.source: Configure asset delivery policy using **.NET** or **REST API**.
trans-unit.target: Configure asset delivery policy using **.NET** or **REST API**.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Azure CDN
trans-unit.target: Enabling Azure CDN

trans-unit.source: Media Services supports integration with Azure CDN.
trans-unit.target: Media Services supports integration with Azure CDN.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to enable Azure CDN, see [How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account](media-services-manage-origins.md#enable_cdn).
trans-unit.target: For information on how to enable Azure CDN, see [How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account](media-services-manage-origins.md#enable_cdn).

trans-unit.source: Scaling a Media Services account
trans-unit.target: Scaling a Media Services account

trans-unit.source: You can scale **Media Services** by specifying the number of **Streaming Reserved Units** and **Encoding Reserved Units** that you would like your account to be provisioned with.
trans-unit.target: You can scale **Media Services** by specifying the number of **Streaming Reserved Units** and **Encoding Reserved Units** that you would like your account to be provisioned with.

trans-unit.source: You can also scale your Media Services account by adding storage accounts to it.
trans-unit.target: You can also scale your Media Services account by adding storage accounts to it.

trans-unit.source: Each storage account is limited to 500 TB.
trans-unit.target: Each storage account is limited to 500 TB.

trans-unit.source: To expand your storage beyond the default limitations, you can choose to attach multiple storage accounts to a single Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: To expand your storage beyond the default limitations, you can choose to attach multiple storage accounts to a single Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: [This](media-services-how-to-scale.md) topic links to relevant topics.
trans-unit.target: [This](media-services-how-to-scale.md) topic links to relevant topics.
